title: Gordon Ramsey VS Woman in COMPLETE denial

comments.comment: I love how the waiter is laughing in the background while Gordon’s being served the food like “lmao we’re fucked”
I have to compliment that young chef on his humility, he was genuinely excited when he was told an experienced chef was coming in to help him out.
Man it’s so satisfying, seeing Gordon Ramsay have a strong personality against these crazy people
As someone who worked in restaurants for the majority of my 20s I can tell you the reactions of the staff were 100% legit. No acting.

Abby: “You’re one of those customers that I would fire immediately.”

This woman is literally insane
I like how the employees actively want their boss to be embarrassed.
At this point, Ramsay asking them to rate their own food is just to gauge how delusional they are

13:56 “You stuck up precious little b**ch” 
-Chef Ramsey
The fact that the waiters and other employees were laughing while Gordan was trying the food makes me think they're over it at this point lmao

When they realized there was no head chef, but one guy was "technically" the head chef. That is code for "I fired the head chef and put the responsibility on the next best guy we got, but I didn't promote him in order to keep him at 15 bucks an hour"
I will never understand how an owner of a failing restaurant calls for GORDON RAMSEY and gets surprised when he says the food is wack

13:52
I about lost it with his reaction 
You do NOT get into a verbal fight with Gordon, especially not when YOU called him to YOUR failing restaurant

Gordon Ramsey "can you give us some privacy"

Felix’s channel is slowly becoming a Gordon Ramsay reaction channel and I’m here for it.
"Can you imagine your employees talking about you like that?" As a waiter I can tell you that yes, it's totally realistic.

16:40 I think it's because in Japan, alot of the foods on the menu pair together. It might be  a big menu BUT it's all from the same recycled 10 or 15 ingredients with similar preparation steps. It's easy to manage as opposed to a menu of 50 items all with their own special ingredients and preparation requirements.
I love how the waiters are just laughing hysterically

Gordon : "You're in denial!"
Owner : "I'm not in denial!" LMAO she's in denial about being in denial!

In defense of Jimmy, running a line during a rush is tough, it can be extremely stressful juggling so many things at once and getting everything timed out properly.  Not everybody is cut out for it, you can be a great cook and still not have the skill set to manage a line, so I can't fault someone that was thrust into that position for not doing a great job, cuz it's a hard job.

"So my 33 years in the business is sh*t?"

I feel bad for the defacto head chef. They trusted the role at him with no actual job change and didn't train him at all. Then had the audacity to blame him for all the issues.

The thing about menu size is really dependent on what kind of restaurant you're running. Like... Taco Bell has a pretty big menu (its not all posted on the menus outside), and so does Waffle House, but that's because all the menu items are made out of the same types of ingredients, for the most part. But at a restaurant like this, and how she's made the menu, she's put several different cuisines on there, which require trips to different shops/multiple supplier deliveries, much more fridge and freezer space, and much more knowledgeable staff to make those different dishes /well/. I'm not shitting on the staff; I'm sure if they were given better conditions and everything they could make some banging calamari, meatloaves, pizza. Their manager is just so piss-poor it's frightening.
As someone that watched all kitchen nightmare videos multiple times its nice to have a new reason to watch them again. Thanks poods

Petition for Felix to react to the follow up Amy’s Baking Company episode:

16:40 Theres actually a ted talk about things like this. In asia the level of skill required to own a restaurant is incredibly high. They know hundreds of dishes. Makes them perfectly and sometimes double or triple dishes at the same time. And they get paid minimum wage. Thats why a lot of asian food is great. Be it thai. chinese food or japanese food or korean. They have the competition. but they also have the skills. If its an actual legitemate shop they usualy know these recipes by heart thats why there are so many. But compared to western restaurants. Their menu often stays static. No rotation. But they have enough variety to keep people interested.
22:10 "THIS IS A REALLY GOOD CAESAR SALAD!!!"
